input_text:
Job Title: Director of Brewing Operations

Location: Detroit, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Summary: The Director of Brewing Operations is a regular, full-time, salaried position responsible for the overall performance of brewing operations at Atwater Brewery. Primary focus will be placed on activities relating to the manufacturing process and productivity improvements in the areas of brewing, packaging, safety, quality assurance, engineering, supply chain and maintenance. The Director of Brewing Operations will be a member of the leadership team and participate in the planning, development and execution of key business objectives associated with the overall Atwater Brewery long term and short term business plans. The position will report directly to the President.
Essential Job Functions:· Identify and implement best practices in all areas of the brewing, packaging, safety, quality assurance, engineering, supply chain and maintenance. Includes designing and continually improving audit processes that effect all operations· Lead the organizational development, talent assessment and succession planning throughout brewing operations· Acts as the Atwater Operations liaison between Atwater and MolsonCoors—this includes management of the relationships with Supply Chain, Quality, Brewing, Engineering, and other operational functions· Design and oversee maintenance of brewery systems and key performance indicators for brewery operations· Management of production schedule in the Detroit facility, as well as the primary POC for Atwater’s co-manufacturing partner (10th Street). Key highlights of the relationship with 10th Street include production cadence, recipe optimization, shipping & receiving, and joint business planning· Work with Molson Coors team on implementation of 5S Lean Manufacturing, site waste loss principles, and efficiency improvement· Monthly reporting of Atwater KPIs to appropriate Molson Coors stakeholders· Identify opportunities to improve gross margin performance throughout operations with targeted cost reductions and improved efficiencies· Develop specific short-term and long-term plans for forecasted production needs together with supporting budget requests and financial estimates· Benchmark key metrics of success for brewing operations systems against the industry’s best practices or standards· Provides input and support to the leadership team in the development of collaborations, affiliations and partnership arrangements· Provide support, leadership and promote conformity to all organizational policies and procedures· Develop, maintain and sustain all safety related organizational protocols and training procedures. Responsible for developing a safety culture that all employees recognize as paramount to organizational success with a focus on continual improvement· Act as the EHS lead for the brewery, accountable for the EPA, OSHA, FDA standards and the Molson Coors Safety and Compliance KPIs and Incident Reporting and Management Protocols. Will be the key point of contact for all site audits and compliance training for brewery and taprooms· Uphold and exemplify all Atwater Values on a daily basis. Atwater’s values include Teamwork, Quality, Community, Innovation and Fun!· Perform additional tasks and responsibilities as directed by the President

Competencies:To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies to perform the essential functions of this position.· Analytical - the individual synthesizes complex or diverse information in an efficient and expedient time frame. Analytical decisions should be both practical & strategic with a holistic perspective on the impact of such decisions for both the short-term objectives and the long-term goals of the organization· Communication - the individual speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations, demonstrates group presentation skills and directs productive meetings· Leadership - the individual inspires and motivates others to perform well and accepts feedback from others· Adaptability - the individual adapts to changes in the internal work environment and external marketplace, manages competing demands and can deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events· Delegation - the individual is effective at assigning tasks to ensure responsibility, accountability and promote organizational efficiency· Judgment - the individual displays willingness to make executive decisions, exhibits sound & accurate judgment and makes timely decisions in the best interests of the company

Knowledge & Skill Requirements:Minimum of 5+ years of brewery managerial experience with full operations production responsibility, employee performance management, safety and regulatory compliance. Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Brewing Science or related field.Candidate must have exemplary knowledge of all aspects of the craft beer industry and brewing processes, effective oral & written communication skills and excellent interpersonal skills. Candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Office softwareThe candidate should possess a strong understanding of all areas of safety and equipment design particular to a production brewery. Additionally, the candidate should have a strong skill set related to mechanical, electrical and industrial systems as they pertain to an engineering setting.The candidate should be able to lift a minimum of 50lbs, spend a full shift on their feet, and assist with production needs on an as needed basisIdeal candidate should be an energetic, forward-thinking and creative individual with high ethical standards and an appropriate professional image. Candidate should be a strategic thinker with sound technical skills, analytical ability, good judgment, and strong operational focus. The ideal candidate should be an exemplary educator who is trustworthy and willing to share information and serve as a mentor within the organization.Preferred Qualifications: Previous managerial brewery operations experience in a craft brewery or similar industry capacity with 8+ years’ experience. Additional certification in Lean Manufacturing programs and processes is a plus. Project management experience within brewery operations is desired.
Atwater Brewery is located in Detroit, Michigan with additional locations in Grosse Pointe Park, and Grand Rapids, Michigan. We believe that our knowledge of brewing, hard work, and attention to detail is evident in every beer we craft. Employee benefits include health, dental & vision insurance, 401K and a rewarding environment based upon our culture, values and mission.Atwater Brewery is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination against any employee or applicant seeking employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, public assistance status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*This description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills or working conditions associated with the position. It is intended to accurately reflect the activities and requirements of the position, but duties may be added, deleted, or modified as necessary. This description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.
IndustryFood and Beverage Manufacturing
Employment TypeFull-time

Experience Level (if available): None
